entry.def: When two liquids of different thicknesses emulsify or when they are emulsified, they combine.

example.ex: It is the pressure which releases the coffee oils; these emulsify and give the coffee its rich, velvety texture...
example.tran: 压力将咖啡的油脂挤出，这些油脂经乳化带给咖啡一种浓郁、柔滑的口感。

example.ex: Whisk the cream into the mixture to emulsify it...
example.tran: 将奶油搅打到混合物中，使其乳化。

means.word_mean: 1. (of immiscible or not completely miscible liquids) blended by the suspending of small globules of one liquid (as oil) in another (as water or vinegar)

auth_sentence.content: For the watercress, whisk the Dijon mustard, white wine vinegar and rapeseed oil together in a small bowl until emulsified.
auth_sentence.res_content: For the watercress, whisk the Dijon mustard, white wine vinegar and rapeseed oil together in a small bowl until emulsified.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For the watercress, whisk the Dijon mustard, white wine vinegar and rapeseed oil together in a small bowl until emulsified.

auth_sentence.content: Gradually add the butter, little by little, constantly whisking until the curd has emulsified.
auth_sentence.res_content: Gradually add the butter, little by little, constantly whisking until the curd has emulsified.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Gradually add the butter, little by little, constantly whisking until the curd has emulsified.

auth_sentence.content: Then, slowly add the grapeseed oil in a thin, steady stream while continuing to blend, until the mixture is thick and emulsified.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then, slowly add the grapeseed oil in a thin, steady stream while continuing to blend, until the mixture is thick and emulsified.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then, slowly add the grapeseed oil in a thin, steady stream while continuing to blend, until the mixture is thick and emulsified.
